title: Father, how wide thy glory shines
author: Isaac Watts

verses.text:
Father, how wide thy glory shines!
How high thy wonders rise!
Known through the earth by countless signs,
By countless through the skies.

Those mighty orbs proclaim thy power,
Their motions speak thy skill;
And on the wings of every hour
We read thy patience still.

But when we view thy strange design
To save rebellious worms,
Where vengeance and compassion join
In their divinist forms;

Here the whole Deity is known;
Nor dares a creature guess
Which of the glories brightest shoneâ€”
The justice, or the grace.

Now the full glories of the Lamb
Adorn the heavenly plains;
While seraphs chant Immanuel's name,
And try their choicest strains.

Wonder and joy shall tune my heart,
And love command my tongue.
O may I bear some humble part
In that immortal song!
